alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 1:50PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Illinois, including the following counties, Clinton and Washington. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported numerous roads still closed from flooding. Some creeks and streams are continuing to rise as well. Flooding is already occurring. Radar estimates between 4 and 7 inches of rain fell this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Breese, New Baden, Nashville, Trenton, Aviston, Okawville, Germantown, Albers, Wamac, Beckemeyer, Lively Grove, Irvington, Ashley, New Memphis, Bartelso, Beaucoup, Hoyleton, Johannisburg, Hoffman and Damiansville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 34 and 61.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
